intro: Ficus juruensis, commonly known as the Juruénsis fig tree, is a tropical species native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a large evergreen tree that can grow up to 30 meters tall, characterized by its broad, lobed leaves and smooth, gray bark. The plant produces small, clustered figs that are an important food source for various wildlife. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine by indigenous communities for their purported healing properties. Ficus juruensis plays a vital role in maintaining the ecological balance of its habitat.
